description: The Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Nord Kivu imposed a 14-day confinement on the eastern city of Goma, effective May 20, 2020. The provisions of which include a police-enforced mandatory curfew from 8:00 pm to 5:00 am. The police have limited movement within city limits by setting up roadblocks as well as by detaining or imposing fines [20,000 to 200,000 Congolese francs ($11 to $110)] on those found in violation of the new curfew.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: No the curfew times are always the same regardless of the day of the week
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On December 18, 2020, the government of the Democratic Republic of the Congo imposed a nationwide curfew from 9pm to 5am. No end date has been announced. During curfew, only the movement of persons with special authorization from the provincial authority, with the exception of persons in a health emergency, will be permitted.
type_sub_cat: No the curfew times are always the same regardless of the day of the week

description: As of September 24, 2020, travelers entering the Democratic Republic of the Congo, regardless of the origin of their travel, are not required to quarantine so long as they show a negative COVID-19 test taken within 72 hours of departure from their point of origin. description: On November 3, 2020, Democratic Republic of the Congo updated exit requirements for international travelers to limit the spread of COVID-19. The policy also applies to essential workers such as teachers, medics, and students. Travelers must follow health protocols, including rapid tests for COVID-19 before being allowed to proceed to their destinations in a bid to prevent the virus's spread.

description: With the March 24 State of Emergency, the President of the Democratic Republic of the Congo instructed the government "to find ways to supply the crowded cities, where there is an almost permanent lack of water and electricity, to ensure hygiene; to increase the number of hand washing points in the country's airports and to support the teams of the Airways Authority (RVA) and the General Directorate of Migration (DGM) so that no one escapes the hygiene control."

description: On March 23, 2020, the Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Haut-Katanga imposed a 2-day confinement on the entire region. The measure was taken after two people who arrived on a Congo Airways plane tested postive for coronavirus arrived to the city of Lubumbashi. This 48-hour confinement was announced in order to trace the other travelers aboard this flight and was enforced by the military and police.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On 28 March, 2020, the Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Kinshasa imposed a 3-week confinement on the entire region. The population will be authorized to go out two days per week to purchase food and other basic necessities. Only administrative staff providing minimum services as well as healthcare personnel will be allowed to circulate. UPDATE: On March 27, the provincial government announced it would postpone the total lockdown of Kinshasa.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On April 6, 2020, the Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Kinshasa imposed a 14-day confinement on the eastern city of Gombe. The measures are enforced by the provincial police with threat of fines and/or imprisonment. Gombe is considered the political, diplomatic and economic hub of the DRC as well as its "epidemic epicenter". Healthcare personnel, journalists and employees of banks and telecommunications services will be allowed to circulate freely while a maximum of 10 persons per company are authorized to enter Gombe.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

description: On April 6, 2020, the Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Kinshasa imposed a 14-day confinement on the eastern city of Gombe. The measures are enforced by the provincial police with threat of fines and/or imprisonment. Gombe is considered the political, diplomatic and economic hub of the DRC as well as its "epidemic epicenter". Healthcare personnel, journalists and employees of banks and telecommunications services will be allowed to circulate freely while a maximum of 10 persons per company are authorized to enter Gombe. UPDATE: On April 20, the governor of Kinshasa announces the gradual deconfinement of the commune of Gombe which will begin on Tuesday, April 21. The process of deconfinement will take place as follows: (1) The security barriers of the Congolese National Police in Gombe will remain in place and (2) Banks will be open, as well as food supplies to allow residents to obtain supplies.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
On 11 March, 2020, the governemnt of the Democratic Republic of the Congo launched its COVID-19 preparedness and response plan which established a multisectoral response committee for COVID-19 (CMR-COVID-19). CMR-COVID-19 is chaired by the Prime Minister, while the Minister of Health acts as Secretary. It provides the government's policy direction, mobilizes resources and manages funds. 

"The COVID-19 is comprised primarily of the following departments: Interior, Security and Customary Affairs; Health; Finance; Budget; Communication and Media; Transport and Communication Channels; Fisheries and Livestock; Planning; Social Affairs; Humanitarian Actions and National Solidarity; Higher and University Education (ESU); Scientific Research and Technological Innovation; Defense, National and Veterans Affairs; Justice and Attorney General; Primary, Secondary and Technical Education; Environment and Sustainable Development; International Cooperation, Regional Integration and Francophonie; Foreign Affairs."
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Democratic Republic of the Congo is enforcing a 14-day self-quarantine on passengers having traveled to China, France, Germany, Italy, Iran, South Korea, and Iraq in the 14 days prior to their arrival into the country but who show no symptoms at their time of arrival.
